CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Rehabilitation Center?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Rehabilitation Center is arc {Emergency Medical Center}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Tertiary General Hospital?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Tertiary General Hospital is arc {Emergency Medical Center}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Emergency Medical Center} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Tertiary General Hospital} has the largest input flow.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Rehabilitation Center to Emergency Medical Center in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Emergency Medical Center to Rehabilitation Center in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Emergency Medical Center and Rehabilitation Center in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Emergency Medical Center and Rehabilitation Center is {417}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Emergency Medical Center and Tertiary General Hospital in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Emergency Medical Center and Tertiary General Hospital is {419}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Emergency Medical Center?
SC.A: The total flow output from Emergency Medical Center is {924}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Emergency Medical Center?
SC.A: The total flow input by Emergency Medical Center is {629}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 463? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {507} from {Emergency Medical Center} to {Tertiary General Hospital}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 137? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {75} from {Tertiary General Hospital} to {Rehabilitation Center}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 137 and 418? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {199} from {Rehabilitation Center} to {Tertiary General Hospital}, a flow of {417} from {Emergency Medical Center} to {Rehabilitation Center}, a flow of {210} from {Rehabilitation Center} to {Emergency Medical Center}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Tertiary General Hospital to Emergency Medical Center or from Rehabilitation Center to Tertiary General Hospital?
NC.A: The flow from {Tertiary General Hospital} to {Emergency Medical Center} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Tertiary General Hospital to Rehabilitation Center, from Tertiary General Hospital to Emergency Medical Center, or from Emergency Medical Center to Rehabilitation Center?
NC.A: The flow from {Tertiary General Hospital} to {Emergency Medical Center} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Emergency Medical Center}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Emergency Medical Center} and {Tertiary General Hospital}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Tertiary General Hospital, Arc Emergency Medical Center, Arc Rehabilitation Center}.
